nodes.text: Experts have stated that evidence shown from FDA approved electronic cigarettes could potentially be safer than the use of regular cigarettes
In a study conducted in 2010 with 3,587 participants, 92% of those participants stated it helped them to smoke less.
It’s stated that the initial start-up for electronic cigarettes is more expensive but depending on how often the consumer uses them, it could be considerably more cost effective.
The appeal may attract those who never smoked in the first place, especially the youth of today’s society and it may be regarded as a gate way drug to introduce them in to more dangerous territory.
Studies show that the amount of Formaldehyde consumed on average is five times greater than those of regular cigarettes, meaning there is five time greater risk of having cancer.
There is a tendency to inhale more with an electronic cigarette as compared to a regular cigarettes as the liquid lasts much longer.
Chris: Chris : Experts have stated that evidence shown from FDA approved electronic cigarettes could potentially be safer than the use of regular cigarettes
